title: Chili Frito Pie
ingredients: 4 cups (about 1 pound) grated cheese; preferably a combination of cheeses
8 cups chili con carne; preferably homemade
6 to 8 pickled jalapeño chilies, preferably thin rounds
instructions: Position a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat the oven to 350° F.

Spread four cups of Fritos in a 9- by 13-inch baking dish, reserving two cups for later use.  Spread half of the cheese over the Fritos then on top of the cheese spoon the chili.  Sprinkle the onions and the pickled jalapeños on top of the chili; then, spread the remaining Fritos on top.  Lastly, spread the remaining grated cheese on top of the last layer of Fritos.

Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes; or, until the chili is bubbling and the cheese is melted and lightly browned.  Remove the casserole from the oven and let it stand on a metal grate for at least 5 minutes before serving.
It’s customary to offer salsa, sour cream, chopped tomatoes, and shredded romaine lettuce as accompaniments for the Chili Frito Pie.
Remarks:  The pickled jalapeño slices may be spread on a half or a third of the casserole dish if you wish to provide someone the option of chili Frito pie without all the “fire.”

Source:  The El Paso Chile Company’s Texas Border Cookbook, by W. Park Kerr and Norma Kerr, published by William Morrow and Co., Inc., New York, © 1992 by W. Park Kerr and Norma Kerr and Michael McLaughlin.
